intro: Elymus brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed wheatgrass, is a perennial grass native to the western United States. It typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sagebrush steppe and rocky soils. Elymus brevipes is valued for its drought tolerance and is sometimes used in restoration projects and as a forage plant.
